Dobrze kupiÄ‡ to sobie na przykÅ‚ad po przejÅ›ciu dwÃ³jki Å¼eby poznaÄ‡ caÅ‚Ä… historiÄ™.

Classic puzzle game, introducing some innovative mechanics. I think it's still worth buying and playing, even tho portal 2 offers you more content and a coop mode. First playthrough is a bit challenging, but noting too hard. There is also a harder version of many stages, where you can really challenge yourself. A well aged game overall and very recommendable.
Felt great to solve the puzzles, but some of the endgame stuff requires use of exploits to finish.

EXACTLY WHAT YOU EXPECT: A GOOD AND ENJOYABLE PUZZLE GAME.
REVIEWS DON'T LIE

Portal is an absolute gaming classic.

Despite being over a decade old now, thanks to it's intuitive and simplistic play-style, yet inventive puzzle solving riddles. It's fair to say the game still holds up very well even by today's standards, with the length of the game being the only thing you could possibly hold up against it.

The game is predominately a puzzle game, where you need to use physics and objects to solve riddles, with a big helping hand from a portal gun. The portal gun allows you to switch quickly between two places, and also use momentum from the switch to launch yourself further than you could normally jump.

Although the game is pretty short, with the main story coming in at just a couple of hours, there are some extra modes available, such as advanced chambers and challenge chambers to help with the longevity. For those who like to see behind the curtain of gaming, there is also the chance to play through the game again whilst listening to the developers commentary. A feature I personally wished more games decided to utilize. 

You are guided throughout the game by GLADOS, who slowly changes into quite the psychopathic little madam, reminiscent of HAL 9000 from 2001: A Space Odyssey, and the small robot turrets have great death animations too.

Overall, even when purchased today. This is still a game well worth your money, even at full price, but with it often being on sale, this should definitely be in your game collection.
